title: Are there more female authors than male authors? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Men have the advantage of history, in that historically women in most cultures weren’t generally permitted the same level of education as men. As a result, the vast majority of literature is made up of male authorship, up until the later 18th Century, where woman gradually started to gain prominence. Even today, if female authors were to outnumber male authors, there is still far too much catching up to do.

It is impossible to get accurate numbers. Many female authors use(d) male pen names to get past misogynist bias. Many male authors use female pen names because the genre they are working in is associated with female authors. My brother was an entertainer and published under his girlfriends name as he didn’t want people to expect his act to mirror his books.
